chat62096.message_body:
Good morning! Welcome to The New York Times live chat of Inauguration Day. The day begins with President Trump’s final departure from the White House and will lead up to the main event: The swearing-in of President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr., who will become the 46th President of the United States.

My co-host this morning will be Peter Baker, our in-house expert on the presidency and we will be chatting with our estimable colleagues Helene Cooper, Carl Hulse, Lisa Lerer, Jonathan Martin, Alan Rappeport, Katie Rogers, Nick Fandos, Jim Tankersley, Katie Glueck and Matt Flegenheimer.

We will be guiding you through the activities and providing real-time insight and context.

chat62116.message_body: Hi Maggie, so glad to be doing this with you today. After four years together covering this presidency, it’s a big moment. And hello to all my fellow chatters. Happy Inauguration Day, as it were.

chat62110.message_body: You’re out at Joint Base Andrews where the president will be departing soon. What’s it like there?

chat62097.message_body: That’s right. I’m currently at Andrews Air Force Base, where Trump is expected to receive a military send-off before he heads to Florida.

chat62098.message_body: So far here’s what’s happening at chilly Andrews Air Force Base – there is a stage set up in front of 17 American flags, Stars and Stripes bunting, and a lectern with a microphone. We will hear from the president before he leaves. The movable staircase the president uses to board Air Force One has been placed behind the stage.

chat62105.message_body: Good morning all and Happy Inauguration Day.

chat62108.message_body: Good morning all. Happy celebration of democracy day. “Quite A Presidency” would make quite a book title.

chat62111.message_body: Morning, friends. Let’s see some democracy.

chat62113.message_body: Good morning to everyone except the Tiger King guy.

chat62109.message_body: I’ve been at Andrews for going on three hours. The president’s supporters who were invited to attend are supposed to have been let in already. So far, there’s no one here.

chat62114.message_body: Maggie, it sounds like the presidency might be ending as it began: with a crowd that Trump would have preferred to be bigger.

chat62115.message_body: Matt, your capacity for understatement is intact over four years.

chat62121.message_body: We can see on camera Marine One heading to the White House to pick up Trump and take him to Joint Base Andrews.

chat62124.message_body: Hello and glad to be with you all. At the same time Trump is preparing to leave the White House, members of Congress and other dignitaries are starting to gather at the Capitol for the swearing in four hours from now. Security, after the Jan. 6 riot there, is off the charts.

chat62125.message_body: Good morning all. This is an unprecedented inaugural day in so many respects. Typically the incoming and outgoing president would be coming together at events at the White House and then at the Capitol to demonstrate the American way of government. But this is an entirely split screen day with President Trump departing on his own and Joe Biden moving into his place as president. None of us have ever seen anything like this before on Jan. 20.

chat62126.message_body: Carl, how many inaugurations have you covered?

chat62127.message_body: This is my ninth! I was a child reporter for President George H.W. Bush’s inauguration in 1989. I will also admit to being at several good inaugural parties over the years. Those are among the things not happening in 2021.

chat62128.message_body: Good morning everyone. The group of journalists whose job it is cover the movements of the president has just been told to assemble for his Marine One departure from the White House to Joint Base Andrews. We will shortly see if President Trump is in the mood to chat before he takes off. Any bets, Maggie?

chat62129.message_body: Which was the most fun, Carl?

chat62133.message_body: Katie, he’s expected to give remarks. I don’t expect him to talk to the press.

chat62136.message_body: But I could see him talking to reporters aboard his final Air Force One ride, the last time he will have a captive-by-job-title audience with the press.

chat62122.message_body: Maggie, are you surprised the crowd is so sparse? What were Trump loyalists saying about seeing him off? Among those not there is Vice President Pence, is that right?

chat62137.message_body: Pence is not expected to be here, as we know. What’s been interesting so far is how many aides who normally fly on Marine One with the president are here already.

chat62138.message_body: That includes Mark Meadows, the chief of staff, and Stephen Miller, the chief speechwriter.

chat62134.message_body: Besides Trump’s lack of graciousness towards Biden, the breakup between Trump and Pence is striking - normally the president and vice-president would be together on their last moments in office.

chat62139.message_body: Good point, Alan. Hard to even fathom that two weeks ago today Pence was locked down in the Capitol for hours as a mob of Trump loyalists stormed the building, some chanting “Hang Pence” because he refused to break with the law and overturn Trump’s loss. It’s been all ice since then.

chat62140.message_body: I mean, that will probably do it.

chat62141.message_body: As far as most memorable, Peter, I think I have to go with Barack Obama’s first inaugural. The crowds were just amazing as seen from my perch at the Capitol. It was freezing but the mood was buoyant. As for most fun, Bill Clinton’s first inaugural had an incredible musical lineup.

chat62143.message_body: The president’s supporters have just been let into the pen that was set up.

chat62142.message_body: Good morning everyone. Like Carl, I’m struck by the contrasts this morning to past inaugurations. I covered Obama’s inauguration in 2009, and I slept in my office downtown to avoid the crush of revelers that overwhelmed D.C. and its transit systems that morning. Today, for Biden, Washington is a ghost town.

chat62146.message_body: Good Morning guys. Waiting for President Trump to depart on Marine One, I’m struck by how, right up until the very end, a president who has displayed little regard for the institutions of America – the Constitution, Congress, the electoral system, still, up to the very last minutes of his presidency, gets the respect and acknowledgement from America’s institutions – the military escort and departure. It’s quite a spectacle to see.

chat62149.message_body: Yes Jim you are right. Typically on inaugural mornings thousands of people move quietly through my Capitol Hill neighborhood before the sun comes up to get to the inaugural. It is always a spectacle. This morning the streets are deserted. It is very strange.

chat62150.message_body: Excited to join you all! This is a day Joseph R. Biden Jr. has been thinking about on and off for at least 50 years – though he can’t have imagined it would look quite like this.

chat62151.message_body: Katie, I know Joe Biden would have preferred a different inaugural but after his previous failures in pursuing the job it still has to be an incredible moment for him.

chat62152.message_body: Absolutely, Carl. He made it on his third try and after 36 years in the Senate.

chat62155.message_body: Trump is late leaving the White House. He was up late, of course, signing 143 last-minute pardons and commutations that Maggie and some of our other colleagues covered.

chat62153.message_body: One early question that I imagine Biden will get is whether Trump left the traditional note for him in the Resolute Desk in the Oval Office. Maggie, do you have any sense of whether he decided to pen one?

chat62156.message_body: Alan, my understanding is no note or letter still.

chat62154.message_body: While the president is expected to speak, it’s not clear if he plans to use remarks aides have drafted for him or to wing it, which he prefers.

chat62157.message_body: Peter, do we expect any more pardons before noon?

chat62158.message_body: So striking that every step of Biden’s would-be revelry has been complicated by the forces of 2020/2021: a virtual convention mid-pandemic, several days’ wait for an election call and a first-of-its-kind inauguration two weeks after a riotous mob stormed the Capitol, without his predecessor in attendance.

chat62161.message_body: Trump emerges with Melania Trump and walks over to the press pool.

chat62162.message_body: Trump can be heard saying: “The honor of a lifetime. The greatest people in the world. The greatest home in the world.”

chat62163.message_body: Melania Trump, who is usually stone-faced during these walks, gives a smile to the press.

chat62165.message_body: “Hopefully it’s not a long term goodbye,” the president says.

chat62168.message_body: The Trumps walk to Marine One, hand in hand.

chat62169.message_body: Mrs. Trump remains as silent as ever though. Katie, i tore through your story today.

chat62167.message_body: Trump gives a thumbs up, Melania, wearing dark glasses, smiles and waves.

chat62170.message_body: Trump gives a fist pump before boarding

chat62166.message_body: Perhaps hinting at another run for the presidency in 2024.

chat62174.message_body: Interesting Jim. Hopes yet of a political resurrection. That is what Senate Democrats – and some Republicans – hope to stamp out with an impeachment trial.

chat62175.message_body: Exactly, Carl. Usually outgoing presidents head straight for vacation and try to disappear entirely from public view. I can’t imagine that would be Trump’s style anyway, but instead he is about to stand trial in the Senate on an impeachment charge of inciting an insurrection against the Capitol. Today is all about pomp, but the trial could start before the week is through keeping Trump all over the news.

chat62172.message_body: Thanks for reading, Helene. Maggie and I assessed her final legacy as the first lady who arrived in Washington late and checked out early in any meaningful sense.

chat62171.message_body:
For those who did not see the Melania story by Katie and Maggie, read it here.

Melania Trump’s Legacy: Missteps, Mystery and, in the End, Absence

chat62176.message_body: Republicans in the days ahead will be weighing whether to convict Trump and bar him from ever holding office again. Pretty tough calculus.

chat62177.message_body: Meanwhile, from the email inbox: Reporters been assembled to cover Joe Biden’s first event of the day, which will be a church service at the Cathedral of St. Matthew the Apostle. “Arrange your snacks,” the pool reporter writes. “It’s going to be a long day.”

chat62178.message_body: Nick, is Trump expected to be back in Washington to testify?

chat62183.message_body: Alan, that is a question everyone in Washington is dying to know. It’s hard to see Trump testifying, but the question is whether he will mount a defense or snub the trial altogether. Both moves may be risky.

chat62182.message_body: As the military expert here, I would like to point out some salient facts about Marine One. It is a Sikorsky VH-3 category helo, as we say in the battlefield.

chat62181.message_body: This is the first time an outgoing president has refused to attend to attend his successor’s inauguration since Andrew Johnson in 1869, when he was miffed that the new president, Ulysses S. Grant, didn’t want to share a carriage with him. (Woodrow Wilson traveled with Warren Harding to the Capitol for his inauguration in 1921 but didn’t stay for the ceremony because of his feeble health.)

chat62186.message_body: I know we have all come to expect the totally different from President Trump, but I’m still coming to grips with the fact that he will not be part of the inauguration. Total break with tradition and presidential role. An outlier to the end.

chat62185.message_body: Peter, what’s your expectation for the Biden speech later?

chat62187.message_body: Biden will talk about unity in broad strokes and stay away from policy or specifics. Don’t expect him to mention Trump by name.

chat62184.message_body: Amazing as we watch Marine One carrying Trump from the White House for a final time.

chat62189.message_body: The president, we can imagine, is now looking down on Washington — the National Mall, the White House, the Capitol — one final time from this particularly privileged view of Marine One. It must be strange after hundreds of rides.

chat62190.message_body: Has the pen filled in, Maggie?

chat62188.message_body: There are some familiar faces in the president’s crowd, like Dr. Seb Gorka, Sean Spicer, Hogan Gidley.

chat62194.message_body: The president’s adult children are here, preparing to travel on then plane a final time.

chat62196.message_body: The pen is about a third full.

chat62191.message_body: In his younger days, Biden fancied himself as a true orator, but in more recent years he is known more an avuncular folksy style.

chat62193.message_body: It is still an open question to me whether he thinks that way, Nick!

chat62195.message_body: Carl, that’s what i mean about this dichotomy between his abandonment of even the most basic part of American institutions, and yet our institutions’ refusal to abandon him, and continuing to give him the respect and trappings of the presidency. In a way it makes it feel like the institutions are stronger than the person.

chat62198.message_body: Lets hope so Helene. I think people are counting on that moving forward.

chat62199.message_body: We just heard “Fortunate Son,” a Trump rally staple and always-interesting choice, play before his send-off.

chat62200.message_body: The pen here at Andrews is not empty but it’s not the crowd they had hoped for.

chat62201.message_body: And so far it appears to be mostly people on the edges of the president’s orbit.

chat62202.message_body: Earlier this morning we could hear some Rocky music (Eye of the Tiger) playing at Andrews.

chat62203.message_body: In my inbox: Kevin McCarthy, the Republican leader in the House, blasts out the “top five accomplishments of the Trump-Pence Administration,” starting with tax cuts. McCarthy stood by Trump until the end, opposing impeachment, but he like almost every other Republican is now trying to navigate a fast growing schism in the party over Trump.

chat62205.message_body: Have to say as a wannabe musician, Matt, Trump’s playlist always confounds me.

chat62206.message_body: At least one thing stays consistent: The playlist. Trump handpicks these songs.

chat62207.message_body: There was some new material earlier! Sting, among others.

chat62204.message_body: Matt, any thoughts on the state of the G.O.P. after four years of Trump.

chat62208.message_body: Rocky, Nick! (Speaking of “Eye of the Tiger.”) Trump wants to remain its kingmaker. Much of his base will be with him, of course. The coming weeks might tell us a lot.

chat62210.message_body: But now we are back to the favorites.

chat62212.message_body: Nick, is Kevin McCarthy joining the other congressional leaders with Joe Biden at mass this morning? I confess to having lost track of that.

chat62213.message_body: So it takes between four to six minutes to helo to Andrews from the White House. Or, as those of us who do it by car at rush hour, a bit longer.

chat62215.message_body: Carl, we are expecting the “big four” congressional leaders — McCarthy, Senator Mitch McConnell, Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senator Chuck Schumer — to join Biden for Mass, yes.

chat62220.message_body: Marine One is in sight at Andrews

chat62222.message_body: As the strains of “Gloria” play in the background.

chat62226.message_body: Marine One landing to the swells of “Gloria” is what we call: chef’s kiss.

chat62225.message_body: “But you really don’t remember, was it something that they said, all the voices in your head.”

chat62228.message_body: Maggie and Katie, have you two been up all night?

chat62231.message_body: I wonder if Trump slept at all.

chat62233.message_body: “Slept a bit” is way above average for you, Maggie!

chat62234.message_body: You are reciting Laura Brannigan lyrics.

chat62236.message_body: Marine One is wheels down at Andrews.

chat62240.message_body: Laura Brannigan, right? I better google. I was right!

chat62241.message_body: The president is about to step off Marine One for the last time.

chat62242.message_body: Just spitballing but maybe sleep would be a good idea tonight.

chat62243.message_body: Peter, I keep thinking about the letter HW Bush left for Clinton. And how he wrote in his own journals about processing the loss.

chat62245.message_body: I don’t anticipate we get that level of candor from the current president, ever.

chat62244.message_body: So while the Pentagon has been completely turned inside out for the last two weeks by the riots and President Trump’s tumultuous departure, the machinery of the American military still knows how to roll out its brass. He’s supposed to get a 21 gun salute and band.

chat62246.message_body:
Here’s a sampling of the letters left by outgoing presidents to their successors for the curious.

The Letters Presidents Leave Their Successors

chat62247.message_body: The military band is marching forward where the president is speaking.

chat62248.message_body: Journals? We don’t even have his tweets now, technically.

chat62249.message_body: Helene, is Journey also a formal part of the military welcome?

chat62250.message_body: Trump spent four years blurring the official with the political. Hearing his rally playlist in this moment feels about right.

chat62256.message_body: It’s Trump-style pomp at its finest.

chat62258.message_body:
Also, I am thinking of this great story by Annie from a couple days ago. As we watch Trump and Biden, back at the White House, cleaning and moving staff are furiously trying to turn the executive mansion over for the next guest.

They Prepare the White House for a New President. They Have 5 Hours.

chat62259.message_body: A friend on a text thread reminds me that this was also the closing music for The Sopranos

chat62263.message_body: Trump, followed by the first lady, has left Marine One. They are again walking hand in hand. Which does not always happen.

chat62266.message_body: Hail to the Chief for the last time.

chat62268.message_body: One last rendition of “Hail to the chief” for this particular chief.

chat62270.message_body:
Maggie and I wrote a couple of months ago about the parts of the job Trump actually liked. Pomp ranked high:

What Donald Trump Liked About Being President

chat62269.message_body: “We love you!” The crowd starts to chant.

chat62272.message_body: “Thank you very much and we love YOU!” The president says.
